alert.note: Alert for Culpeper; Fauquier; Prince William; Rappahannock (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 09 at 12:57AM EDT until July 09 at 4:45AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northern Virginia and northwest Virginia, including the following counties: in northern Virginia, Culpeper, Fauquier and Prince William. In northwest Virginia, Rappahannock. * WHEN...Until 700 AM EDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1257 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Culpeper... Warrenton... Linton Hall... Bealeton... Haymarket... Gainesville... New Baltimore... Opal... Remington... Catlett... Calverton... Midland... Jeffersonton... Alanthus... Rixeyville... Brandy Station... Elkwood... Turnbull... Catalpa... Amissville... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
